Mountain Travel Website

This project is a simple landing page for a fictional mountain travel company. They offer different trails and other mountain adventures. The site is meant to be a landing page for some information on the park.

The stack for this project is HTML5, SASS, JavaScript, and GULP.

GitHub Live

Midna Campground Website

Midna Campground is a website that is a landing page for a campground. The user can find some information and photos of the campground. This is a fictional company / location.

I created this project as a fun challenge for myself to create a full website from start to finish in one day. I did end up going in after the challenge to make some changes to it.

The stack for this project is HTML5, SASS, and JavaScript.

GitHub Live

RGB Color Game

This RGB Color game is a game where the player will be shown an RGB value. The player has to choose which color swatch matches the RGB color value given. As you advance in the levels, the game will get harder and harder. This game also takes advantage of LocalStorage so your high scores will be saved on your computer!

The idea for this project came from Drew over at DrewLearns. The project I got the idea from can be found here.

The stack for this project is HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery.

GitHub Live

JavaScript Pokedex

This project was inspired by different icon websites like Feather Icons. The idea for this project was to show a list of the first 151 Pokemon as little cards.

When you click on a card, a little modal will pop up and you can see more details on that Pokemon.

The stack used here is HTML5, CSS, JavaScript. This project used the PokeAPI to get the data and images for all of the Pokemon.
